goal:
The International Credit Insurance & Surety Association (ICISA) promotes sustained technical excellence, industry innovation and product integrity. It represents the interests of its members by facilitating an open exchange of information and ideas, while representing the interests of the trade credit insurance and surety bonding industries to local, national and international government and regulatory bodies. ICISA plays a vital role advising and educating international and multinational authorities and organisations on issues related to trade credit insurance and surety bonds. www.icisa.org
ICISA Promotes the educational foundation STECIS which offers training seminars in trade credit insurance and surety. These seminars are open to ICISA members as well as to external parties. More information available on www.stecis.org.
interests: Competition, Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Solvency II regulations and implementation, level playing field for surety bonds, marketable risk, State Support Schemes, micro-entities account simplification, systemic risk, shadow banking. We are furthermore highly interested in the discussions regarding SME finance and the lack of it. How to cooperate with banks in order to give SMEs better access to finance?
